name: Ankita Dhyani
place_of_birth: Maroda village, Pauri Garhwal district, Uttarakhand, India
biography: Ankita Dhyani is an Indian athlete from Uttarakhand, recognized as a middle-distance and long-distance runner. She is named in the Indian athletics team for the 5000m event in the 2022 Asian Games and has qualified to represent India in the women's 5000m event at the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris.
childhood: Ankita hails from Maroda village in the Pauri Garhwal district of Uttarakhand. She trained at high altitude, running with boys preparing for Army selections in her village, which is located at an elevation of 1400m.
professional_career: Ankita has achieved significant milestones in her career, including winning gold in both the 1500m and 5000m events at the Federation Cup Junior U-20 Athletics Championships in 2021. She set a Junior National record in the 5000m with a time of 16:21.19. She also competed in the 2021 World Under-20 Championships and has consistently performed well in various national and international competitions.
